Package ru.nsu.kozoliy

Class Notebook

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.nsu.kozoliy.Notebook
  • public class Notebook
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a notebook containing a collection of notes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Notebook()
      Constructs an empty notebook.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry​(Note entry)
        Adds a note to the notebook.
        Parameters:
        entry - The note to be added.

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry​(java.lang.String name)
        Deletes a note from the notebook by name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the note to be deleted.

      • getNotesSorted

        public java.util.List<Note> getNotesSorted()
        Gets all notes in the notebook sorted by the time they were created.
        Returns:
        A list of notes sorted by creation time.

      • getNotesInRangeWithKeywords

        public java.util.List<Note> getNotesInRangeWithKeywords​(java.time.LocalDateTime from,
                                                        java.time.LocalDateTime to,
                                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> words)
        Gets notes from the notebook within a specified time range and containing specific keywords in the name.
        Parameters:
        from - The start of the time range.
        to - The end of the time range.
        words - A list of keywords to filter notes by name.
        Returns:
        A list of notes matching the criteria, sorted by creation time.

      • showByName

        public java.lang.String showByName​(java.lang.String name)
        Shows the content of a note by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the note to show.
        Returns:
        The content of the note with the specified name.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method for testing the functionality of the Notebook class.
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments (not used in this context).
